397 - 11 Dec 2023 03:49PM - Saloni Edoofa: Goodafternoon Parents,coming back to my story……….Studying abroad in lndia has some benefits, 1.You have an opportunity to meet new friends from different countries like Zambia,South Africa and Tanzania etc hence an advantage to learn new cultural practices and languages.As for me lam now connected to some students from lndia,Zambia and Cameroon and lam finding it helpful to me.The lndians are teaching me their language that is Hindi 2.Free internet connection is available in lndia,each day you get your 2GB data,you call for free at anytime you just feel like calling your local friends 3.The economy is very stable,goods and services are bought at a lower costs,all things are very cheap be it food,clothes,books and blankets etc 4.Water in lndia is for free there is no need to pay for it and it is always available ,you wash and bath as many times as you want,you won’t be charged 5.A chance also to explore new things,like the electric buses and trains ,,,visiting the Malls 6.lndia have the best Universities and hardworking members of the faculties ,no student is allowed to miss the classes,there is a rule in each University which says that each student must maintain 75% attendance and failure to do that will not be allowed to seat for the examinations and will be expelled from the school,hence it is a benefit as we are being taught to be hardworkers and to be always punctual,if a student is late for the lesson he or she will not be allowed to enter the classroom.As for me lam seeing that it is a very good thing as this doesn’t promote laziness but hardworkers and making us not to forget the purpose of leaving our country coming abroad.  So as an lnternational student lam really enjoying,lam staying outside the campus……To get the accommodation l was helped by Edoofa and lam staying close to my university,no need for transport l just walk.Mr.Mukund the head of department from Edoofa is always at our school,he is our guardian,he is the one we tell all our problems anytime when we are at school.He is a hardworking man.

These projects are very helpful to us students in the sense that,they helps us to develop the leadership skills like confidence and good communication skills, moreover each week we do online webinars with different motivational speakers, the webinars are very important to us as the stories shared are very inspiring. Today's Saturday activity is designed to help us get familiar with Microsoft Excel, a powerful tool for data organization and analysis. We'll begin with a simple yet practical exercise: creating a Weekly Activity Log and Time Tracker.  Activity Instructions:  Open Microsoft Excel:  Launch Microsoft Excel on your computer or phone. If you don't have it installed, you can use any spreadsheet software available to you. Set Up Columns:  Create three columns with the following headers: "Activity," "Day of the Week," and "Time Spent (in minutes)." Record Your Activities:  Think about the activities you engaged in during the past week, such as studying, exercising, or socializing. In the "Activity" column, list each activity separately. Specify Days:  In the "Day of the Week" column, record the corresponding day for each activity. Log Time:  In the "Time Spent" column, record the amount of time (in minutes) you spent on each activity. Calculate Average Time:  Utilize Excel functions to calculate the average time spent per activity and the overall average time for the week. Reflect:  In a designated area, jot down a brief reflection on your insights from tracking activities and time spent. Save and Submit:  Save the file with an appropriate name (e.g., "WeeklyActivityLog_YourName.xlsx"). Submit the completed spreadsheet following the instructions provided.  Remember, this activity serves as an introduction to Microsoft Excel, and we'll build on these skills in future sessions. Feel free to reach out if you encounter any challenges during the activity.  Let's dive in and make the most of today's exploration of Excel!  Best regards, Ms. Saloni

If you don't have it installed, you can use any spreadsheet software available to you. Set Up Columns:  Create three columns with the following headers: "Activity," "Day of the Week," and "Time Spent (in minutes)." Record Your Activities:  Think about the activities you engaged in during the past week, such as studying, exercising, or socializing. In the "Activity" column, list each activity separately. Specify Days:  In the "Day of the Week" column, record the corresponding day for each activity. Log Time:  In the "Time Spent" column, record the amount of time (in minutes) you spent on each activity. Calculate Average Time:  Utilize Excel functions to calculate the average time spent per activity and the overall average time for the week. Reflect:  In a designated area, jot down a brief reflection on your insights from tracking activities and time spent. Save and Submit:  Save the file with an appropriate name (e.g., "WeeklyActivityLog_YourName.xlsx"). Submit the completed spreadsheet following the instructions provided.  Remember, this activity serves as an introduction to Microsoft Excel, and we'll build on these skills in future sessions. Feel free to reach out if you encounter any challenges during the activity.  Let's dive in and make the most of today's exploration of Excel!  Best regards, Ms. Saloni

251 - 09 Dec 2023 07:37PM - Sharda Edoofa: Hello Kelvin, I hope this message finds you well. Today's Saturday activity is designed to help us get familiar with Microsoft Excel, a powerful tool for data organization and analysis. We'll begin with a simple yet practical exercise: creating a Weekly Activity Log and Time Tracker.  Activity Instructions:  Open Microsoft Excel:  Launch Microsoft Excel on your computer or phone. If you don't have it installed, you can use any spreadsheet software available to you. Set Up Columns:  Create three columns with the following headers: "Activity," "Day of the Week," and "Time Spent (in minutes)." Record Your Activities:  Think about the activities you engaged in during the past week, such as studying, exercising, or socializing. In the "Activity" column, list each activity separately. Specify Days:  In the "Day of the Week" column, record the corresponding day for each activity. Log Time:  In the "Time Spent" column, record the amount of time (in minutes) you spent on each activity. Calculate Average Time:  Utilize Excel functions to calculate the average time spent per activity and the overall average time for the week. Reflect:  In a designated area, jot down a brief reflection on your insights from tracking activities and time spent. Save and Submit:  Save the file with an appropriate name (e.g., "WeeklyActivityLog_YourName.xlsx"). Submit the completed spreadsheet following the instructions provided.  Remember, this activity serves as an introduction to Microsoft Excel, and we'll build on these skills in future sessions. Feel free to reach out if you encounter any challenges during the activity.  Let's dive in and make the most of today's exploration of Excel!  Best regards,  Team EWYL

324 - 12 Dec 2023 09:56AM - Sharda Edoofa: Great to hear that you're taking the initiative to talk to school principals about the Edoofa Scholarship program. It's a fantastic project, and your efforts can make a real difference.  Here are some ways you can reach out:  Write a Letter or Email: Craft a well-written letter or email introducing yourself and explaining why the Edoofa Scholarship program matters. Share details about the program and kindly request a meeting with the school principal.  Give them a Call: A phone call can be a direct and effective way to connect. Be concise, share your enthusiasm for the Edoofa program, and express your interest in setting up a meeting.  Connect on Social Media: Schools are often on social media. Drop them a message or comment on their posts expressing your interest in discussing the scholarship program further. Remember to keep it professional.  Visit in Person: If possible, visit the school in person. Schedule a meeting with the principal and use the opportunity to present the Edoofa Scholarship program. Face-to-face interactions can leave a lasting impression.  Involve Student Representatives: If there are student representatives in your school, team up with them. They can be influential in communicating your message to the school administration.  Attend School Events: Participate in school events where principals are present. Take the chance to briefly introduce yourself and express your interest in discussing the Edoofa Scholarship program later on.  Ask for Teacher Support: Teachers often have good connections with school administrators. Discuss your plan with teachers and seek their support in arranging a meeting with the principal.  Create Eye-Catching Materials: Design informative materials about Edoofa – maybe a cool brochure or a presentation. Share these materials with the principal, along with your request for a meeting.

Set Up Columns:  Create three columns with the following headers: "Activity," "Day of the Week," and "Time Spent (in minutes)." Record Your Activities:  Think about the activities you engaged in during the past week, such as studying, exercising, or socializing. In the "Activity" column, list each activity separately. Specify Days:  In the "Day of the Week" column, record the corresponding day for each activity. Log Time:  In the "Time Spent" column, record the amount of time (in minutes) you spent on each activity. Calculate Average Time:  Utilize Excel functions to calculate the average time spent per activity and the overall average time for the week. Reflect:  In a designated area, jot down a brief reflection on your insights from tracking activities and time spent. Save and Submit:  Save the file with an appropriate name (e.g., "WeeklyActivityLog_YourName.xlsx"). Submit the completed spreadsheet following the instructions provided.  Remember, this activity serves as an introduction to Microsoft Excel, and we'll build on these skills in future sessions. Feel free to reach out if you encounter any challenges during the activity. 150 - 11 Dec 2023 10:00PM - +263 78 087 8756: *4.What are accounting standards and why are they mandatory?*  Accounting standards are the rules and regulations that govern the preparation of financial statements. These standards are developed by various standard-setting bodies, such as the Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB) in the United States.Accounting standards are mandatory is because they help to protect the public interest. Without standards, companies could potentially manipulate their financial information to make their performance look better than it really is. This could lead to investors and creditors making decisions based on false or misleading information. Additionally, if a company's financial statements are not prepared in accordance with standards, it could lead to unfair practices such as tax evasion. So, in a way, standards help to protect the public by ensuring that companies are following the rules and disclosing accurate information.  They ensure consistency and comparability in financial reporting. Without these standards, businesses could use different methods of reporting their financial information, making it difficult to compare and analyze the financial health of different companies. By requiring businesses to follow the same standards, accounting standards help to create a level playing field and promote transparency in the market.
151 - 11 Dec 2023 10:12PM - +263 78 087 8756: *5.Differentiate between Accounting and Auditing* Although the two terms are often used interchangeably, they actually have distinct meanings. Accounting refers to the process of recording and reporting financial transactions, whereas auditing is the independent examination of those transactions and reports. In other words, accountants are responsible for preparing financial statements, while auditors are responsible for reviewing those statements and ensuring that they are accurate and in compliance with relevant standards. So, accounting is more of a bookkeeping function, while auditing is more of a quality control function.  So, the main purpose of accounting is to provide information that is useful in making economic decisions, while the main purpose of auditing is to provide assurance that the financial statements are free from material misstatements. Accounting is also more forward-looking, as it focuses on future transactions and events, while auditing is more backward-looking, as it focuses on past transactions and events.Auditing uses a reasonable assurance standard, meaning that there is a high degree of confidence that the financial statements are accurate and complete. Auditing also goes a step further by looking for fraud and irregularities in the financial statements. <This message was edited>

Moreover, as shared above our Admissions team will be providing you flexible payment plans to pay the registration within 3 or 4 months thereby reducing the financial stress and ensuring timely planning for your higher education.

I am Mr Gurvinder Singh, Senior Career Counselor at Edoofa  I am here to discuss the application of Nchimunya  Welcome to the Edoofa Scholarship Counselling Session  Before we begin with the session, I would like to ask you, what prior understanding you have about the Edoofa Scholarship Program
9 - 12 Dec 2023 12:08PM - +260 97 0269699: Good morning sir
10 - 12 Dec 2023 12:11PM - +260 97 0269699: All I know about Edoofa is that it's a sponsorship program that tries to help us in our academic life especially African countries....it gives us an opportunity to study in India at high institutions.
11 - 12 Dec 2023 12:23PM - +260 97 0269699: It is also a merit based program.... and that Edoofa works with private institutions in India that offer scholarships
12 - 12 Dec 2023 01:14PM - Gurvinder: Yes, that is correct.
13 - 12 Dec 2023 01:14PM - Gurvinder: Let me brief you about the program myself.
14 - 12 Dec 2023 01:14PM - Gurvinder: *Edoofa Scholarship Program* is a well-appreciated program in the SAARC nations and the African continent offering 50-100% scholarships on tuition fees and accommodation. Edoofa has been in the Education space for more than a decade and one question that has always been on our table, and that we have been thinking about every year was *how to improve the quality of education for our candidates with affordability by providing employability skills*  One of the unique aspects of the program is the focus on the skill development of a student through the Earn While You Learn Program wherein a student receives real-time online projects, thereby gaining hands-on knowledge and experiences!
15 - 12 Dec 2023 01:14PM - Gurvinder: We receive applications from South Africa, Zimbabwe, Ghana, Nigeria, Malawi, Uganda, Zambia, Liberia, Kenya, Rwanda, Cameroon, and many more countries. For more than 50,000 applications there are just 5000 scholarship seats which denotes the intense competition and the strict eligibility process to find deserving students and *make education, not just affordable and accessible to them but also employability driven so that Edoofians become future leaders in their domains!*
16 - 12 Dec 2023 01:14PM - Gurvinder: EDOOFA has commended the new government for its dedicated efforts and positive changes in the education sector, including the elimination of school fees, an increase in the number of teachers, and a focus on protecting vulnerable learners, particularly adolescent girls. *Edoofa is proud to support the government in its mission to transform the education sector and achieve sustainable development, aimed at ensuring quality education that is inclusive and equitable for all by 2030.*
25 - 12 Dec 2023 01:43PM - Gurvinder: Okay so Beauty, as we start your counseling session, I would like to brief you that Edoofa assures a minimum of 50% scholarship and a maximum of 100% scholarship.  In order to get a higher quantum of scholarship an applicant has to meet the following metrics.  *1. Proactiveness in Counseling Session*- In my experience of interacting with over 5000+ applicants, what I have observed is that an applicant who is able to complete their counseling stage within a day’s span has a 93% chance of getting a scholarship between 80% to 100% on tuition and accommodation.  *2. Parent’s Participation in the Process*- You see students who have gotten scholarships more than 80% on tuition and accommodation had one thing in common, their parents/guardians, and family members were present throughout their counseling and eligibility process.
26 - 12 Dec 2023 01:43PM - Gurvinder: Having said that, do you think you have what it takes to meet these two significant metrics and get a higher quantum of scholarship?

10 - 12 Dec 2023 01:07PM - Gurvinder: Yes, that is correct.
11 - 12 Dec 2023 01:07PM - Gurvinder: Let me brief you about the program myself.
12 - 12 Dec 2023 01:07PM - Gurvinder: *Edoofa Scholarship Program* is a well-appreciated program in the SAARC nations and the African continent offering 50-100% scholarships on tuition fees and accommodation. Edoofa has been in the Education space for more than a decade and one question that has always been on our table, and that we have been thinking about every year was *how to improve the quality of education for our candidates with affordability by providing employability skills*  One of the unique aspects of the program is the focus on the skill development of a student through the Earn While You Learn Program wherein a student receives real-time online projects, thereby gaining hands-on knowledge and experiences!
13 - 12 Dec 2023 01:07PM - Gurvinder: We receive applications from South Africa, Zimbabwe, Ghana, Nigeria, Malawi, Uganda, Zambia, Liberia, Kenya, Rwanda, Cameroon, and many more countries. For more than 50,000 applications there are just 5000 scholarship seats which denotes the intense competition and the strict eligibility process to find deserving students and *make education, not just affordable and accessible to them but also employability driven so that Edoofians become future leaders in their domains!*
14 - 12 Dec 2023 01:08PM - Gurvinder: EDOOFA has commended the new government for its dedicated efforts and positive changes in the education sector, including the elimination of school fees, an increase in the number of teachers, and a focus on protecting vulnerable learners, particularly adolescent girls. *Edoofa is proud to support the government in its mission to transform the education sector and achieve sustainable development, aimed at ensuring quality education that is inclusive and equitable for all by 2030.*

Proactiveness in Counseling Session*- In my experience of interacting with over 5000+ applicants, what I have observed is that an applicant who is able to complete their counseling stage within a day’s span has a 93% chance of getting a scholarship between 80% to 100% on tuition and accommodation.  *2. However, the credits can be used to pay off a significant part of their higher education fees and make their university education more affordable.  It is the curriculum of the Earn While You Learn Program that helps students to learn and develop 21st-century job skills like Research, Content Writing, SEO, Digital Marketing, Creative Content Creation, Influencer Marketing, Social Media Engagement, and Blog Writing – just to name a few. 18 - 12 Dec 2023 01:54PM - Gurvinder: *Edoofa Scholarship Program* is a well-appreciated program in the SAARC nations and the African continent offering 50-100% scholarships on tuition fees and accommodation. Edoofa has been in the Education space for more than a decade and one question that has always been on our table, and that we have been thinking about every year was *how to improve the quality of education for our candidates with affordability by providing employability skills*  One of the unique aspects of the program is the focus on the skill development of a student through the Earn While You Learn Program wherein a student receives real-time online projects, thereby gaining hands-on knowledge and experiences!
22 - 12 Dec 2023 01:54PM - Gurvinder: *Our strong relationships with educational institutions, such as Penmal Connect Ltd. and Trident College in Zambia, have led to numerous successful outcomes and partnerships with schools including Kamulanga High, Canisius Secondary, Sanjongo Secondary, The Copperbelt University, Chavuma Boarding Secondary, Mutanda Boarding Secondary, Chimwemwe Secondary, National Hillcrest, Matero Boys Secondary, and others. We are also connected with institutions like Njase, Ndola Girls, Fatima Secondary, Torbit, and Zambezi Boarding among others, to provide, expand and build upon the opportunities of the Edoofa Scholarship Program for deserving students throughout Zambia*

22 - 12 Dec 2023 01:48PM - Gurvinder: *Edoofa Scholarship Program* is a well-appreciated program in the SAARC nations and the African continent offering 50-100% scholarships on tuition fees and accommodation. Edoofa has been in the Education space for more than a decade and one question that has always been on our table, and that we have been thinking about every year was *how to improve the quality of education for our candidates with affordability by providing employability skills*  One of the unique aspects of the program is the focus on the skill development of a student through the Earn While You Learn Program wherein a student receives real-time online projects, thereby gaining hands-on knowledge and experiences!
24 - 12 Dec 2023 01:48PM - Gurvinder: Speaking specifically about Zimbabwe, we have more than 2500 students enrolled in the program just in the last year. The Child of the DEO, Manicaland *Sir Abson Mapfumo* is a part of the Edoofa Scholarship Program. *United College of Education*, Bulawayo the best college in Bulawayo is Associated with EDOOFA, and Respected *Sir Adam Luthuli* has her daughter enrolled under the Edoofa Scholarship Program. 197 - 12 Dec 2023 04:55PM - Gurvinder: Since you have understood how Edoofa has made the application process simpler and affordable for the student, let me share with you the payment policy of the same for your better understanding!
198 - 12 Dec 2023 04:56PM - Gurvinder: Ropafadzo basically there are 3 phases of the enrollment process.  *Phase 1:* Counseling session with the Students/Parents and Seat Reservation  If the student is found competent for the program and receives their Reservation Letter, you will have to pay only a part of the Program Fee which is $350 within 7 days from the receipt of your Edoofa Reservation Letter which basically is for the seat reservation and the Earn While You Learn Program.  *Phase 2:* Once the students complete their Phase 1 they will be starting their Earn While you Learn program classes (Each student will have an opportunity to earn credits that can be used to reduce the fee before their A-Level result is out).  *Phase 3:* Once the final A level results are out if the student would have passed the necessary requirement as per Edoofa then their final University evaluation and Admission would be continued. However if the student wouldn't have met the necessary requirements as per the University and Edoofa, then the paid $350 would be refunded to the parents.  *The amount of credit earned by the students during Phase 2 can be used for the student's first year's annual fee as well so that parents do not end up being burdened at the last moment itself.*
199 - 12 Dec 2023 04:56PM - Gurvinder: However, we do know that in most African Nations, economic instability is a major challenge because of which a student might face a challenge in completing their entire fee in a short time span of 7 days, therefore for such instances, parents are provided with flexible fee payment option as well, wherein if the student is found eligible then instead of paying the entire fee in 7 days, parents can complete a part fee of $200 in 7 days and the remaining $150 within next 30 days.

31 - 12 Dec 2023 10:45AM - Gurvinder: *Edoofa Scholarship Program* is a well-appreciated program in the SAARC nations and the African continent offering 50-100% scholarships on tuition fees and accommodation. Edoofa has been in the Education space for more than a decade and one question that has always been on our table, and that we have been thinking about every year was *how to improve the quality of education for our candidates with affordability by providing employability skills*  One of the unique aspects of the program is the focus on the skill development of a student through the Earn While You Learn Program wherein a student receives real-time online projects, thereby gaining hands-on knowledge and experiences!
32 - 12 Dec 2023 10:45AM - Gurvinder: We receive applications from South Africa, Zimbabwe, Ghana, Nigeria, Malawi, Uganda, Zambia, Liberia, Kenya, Rwanda, Cameroon, and many more countries. For more than 50,000 applications there are just 5000 scholarship seats which denotes the intense competition and the strict eligibility process to find deserving students and *make education, not just affordable and accessible to them but also employability driven so that Edoofians become future leaders in their domains!*
33 - 12 Dec 2023 10:45AM - Gurvinder: Speaking specifically about Zimbabwe, we have more than 2500 students enrolled in the program just in the last year. We are associated with more than 200 schools with more than 250 Headmaster, Chairman SDC, and Educationists that are associated with EDOOFA. *Our associate partner, Mr Shorwi Kawadza*, is a reputed Educationalist from Zimbabwe and is the Principal of Hartzell High School. *Hartzell High School*, Mutare has collaborated with us for the past Four Years from which more than 80 students have enrolled and arrived in India already. The Child of the DEO, Manicaland *Sir Abson Mapfumo* is a part of the Edoofa Scholarship Program. *United College of Education*, Bulawayo the best college in Bulawayo is Associated with EDOOFA, and Respected *Sir Adam Luthuli* has her daughter enrolled under the Edoofa Scholarship Program. Similarly, the Daughter of Mr.N.M Maposa, Headmaster of Chibuwe High, the son of Ms Christina Rockson, The Principal of Hilltop Christian High School, South Africa, and the child of *Mrs. Aleta Makomeke*, DEO at Masvingo province are Edoofians and we have many more success stories from St. David's Bonda High, St. Albert’s, Christ Ministries, Advent Hope Academy, Nhowe Mission, Nyazura High, First Class High, etc.

However, the credits can be used to pay off a significant part of their higher education fees and make their university education more affordable.  It is the curriculum of the Earn While You Learn Program that helps students to learn and develop 21st-century job skills like Research, Content Writing, SEO, Digital Marketing, Creative Content Creation, Influencer Marketing, Social Media Engagement, and Blog Writing – just to name a few.  The EWYL Program, therefore, is going to help in the overall growth of a student and help them provide a boost in keeping up with the changing market strategies, needs, and tactics. 211 - 12 Dec 2023 03:17PM - Gurvinder: Since you have understood how Edoofa has made the application process simpler and affordable for the student, let me share with you the payment policy of the same for your better understanding!
212 - 12 Dec 2023 03:17PM - Gurvinder: Prig A basically there are 3 phases of the enrollment process.  *Phase 1:* Counseling session with the Students/Parents and Seat Reservation  If the student is found competent for the program and receives their Reservation Letter, you will have to pay only a part of the Program Fee which is $350 within 7 days from the receipt of your Edoofa Reservation Letter which basically is for the seat reservation and the Earn While You Learn Program.  *Phase 2:* Once the students complete their Phase 1 they will be starting their Earn While you Learn program classes (Each student will have an opportunity to earn credits that can be used to reduce the fee before their A-Level result is out).  *Phase 3:* Once the final A level results are out if the student would have passed the necessary requirement as per Edoofa then their final University evaluation and Admission would be continued. However if the student wouldn't have met the necessary requirements as per the University and Edoofa, then the paid $350 would be refunded to the parents.  *The amount of credit earned by the students during Phase 2 can be used for the student's first year's annual fee as well so that parents do not end up being burdened at the last moment itself.*

66 - 12 Dec 2023 03:33PM - Gurvinder: *Bachelor of Arts in Geography* is 3- year an undergraduate course divided into 6 semesters. It involves the study of the earth and its lands, features, inhabitants, and phenomena.
67 - 12 Dec 2023 03:33PM - Gurvinder: The course curriculum explores not only the geographical features of the earth but also its features and population. It is one of the specializations of Bachelor of Arts (BA) that deals in various areas such as the study of the features of soil, climate, and plantations are covered in the course besides the geography of the world as a whole.  Students enrolled to the course are taken to annual field trips to observe and analyse field data for stimulating awareness of the environment. They are also trained on cartography and report writing through presentations on thematic atlases and field reports. Upon successful completion of the course, graduates are lucratively hired both in private and public sectors, in colleges, universities, NGOs, among others.
68 - 12 Dec 2023 03:33PM - Gurvinder: *What is it About?*  BA in Geography is a 3- year course, minimum eligibility for which is an intermediate qualification in any discipline. Geography is the study of the earth, including aspects such as land, topography, attributes, people and phenomena. Subjects covered in the discipline are Environment and Ecology, Fundamentals of Remote Sensing and GIS, Statistical Techniques, Spatial Analysis, Advanced Physical Geography, Contemporary Human Geography, Computer Aided Mapping, Thematic Atlas, Spatial Economic Systems, Natural Resource Management, Political Geography, Agricultural Geography, Social Geography of India, Urban Settlement System, Regional Development, Cultural Geography, Hydrology and Water Resource Management, Environmental Impact Assessment, Geography of Landscape, Demography and Population Policy, Health, Environment and Society, among others.
67 - 12 Dec 2023 03:33PM - Gurvinder: The course curriculum explores not only the geographical features of the earth but also its features and population. 69 - 12 Dec 2023 03:33PM - Gurvinder: *Who Should Opt?*  Students with the capability of and interest in analysis, problem-solving, decision-making, critically interpreting data and text, developing reasoned arguments, numerical skills, team-work, planning skills, presenting oral and written arguments and information, communication and technology, are best suited for the course.
70 - 12 Dec 2023 03:33PM - Gurvinder: *Career Prospects*  Successful graduates of the course are professionally recruited as Urban and Regional Planners, Remote Sensing Specialists, Researchers etc.  They are also hired in research agencies meant for environmental issues, population studies and rural development, in the teaching profession at universities, colleges, schools and coaching institutes.  Fieldwork is an essential part of the curriculum, aimed at developing students’ practical skills, hands-on experience, useful in fields like commerce, transport and tourism, business, law and finance sectors.  Successful graduates of the course are hired in fields such as:  *Agriculture Research* *GIS and Remote Sensing* *Colleges and University* *Environment Protection Agencies* *Gas Exploration Companies* *Government Research Institutes* *Mining Industry* *NGOs*

252 - 11 Dec 2023 06:18PM - +263 78 883 0814: Section 5   The life in Rwanda after the genocide has undergone significant changes and the country has made remarkable progress in various sectors . Despite the horrific events that took place during the genocide,Rwanda has managed to rebuild and has become one of the fastest growing economic in Africa.  Firstly,one of the most remarkable aspects of life in Rwanda after the genocide is the emphasis on reconciliation.The government has implemented various initiatives to promote unity and healing ,such as the Gacaca courts ,where community members come together to discuss and resolve issues related to the genocide .These efforts have helped rebuild trust and foster social cohesion.  Secondly,Rwanda has experienced significant economic growth in the post-genocide era.The government has focused in attracting foreign investments ,improving infrastructure and diversifying the economy.Sectors such as tourism , agriculture and information technology have been prioritized , contributing to job creation and poverty reduction.  Thirdly Rwanda has invested heavily in infrastructure development to support it's economic growth.The country has improved it's road networks expanded access to electricity,and developed modern cities .This have not improved the quality of life for Rwandans but also made it easier for businesses to operate.  Forthly , the government has prioritized investments in healthcare and education leading to improved access and quality in these sectors .Rwanda has implemented a national health insurance system and made significant strides in reducing maternal and child mortality rates.In education,there has been a strong focus on promoting universal access to education with significant improvements in school enrollment rates.  Lastly ,Rwanda is known for its strong commitment to gender equality .After the genocide,there has been a concerted effort to empower women and promote their participation in all spheres of life , including politics and businesses.Today ,Rwanda has one of the highest rates of female representation in parliament globally.
253 - 11 Dec 2023 06:18PM - +263 78 883 0814: "My Inspirational Story"   My name is Shamiso Mawunze.Born into a middle class family in a small town in Zimbabwe.l really faced numerous challenges and obstacles in terms of receiving my education.My parents are divorced and as a result my mother was forced to raise my brother and I alone.It was sometimes difficult for my mother ,but she really stood and worked for us.   As a young girl,l kept on dreaming of obtaining quality education.Despite the situation,this did not deter my determination to aim for a quality education.  Sometime last year ,l would gather scraps of paper and practice writing my goals and aspirations.l even buried my written dreams in a tin can ,symbolizing my commitment to achieving them.   In a stroke of fate , my mother inspired me to pursue my dream against all odds.With the support of her ,l have managed to complete my ordinary level and now l have reached my advanced level course.My hard work and resilience have paid off.

60 - 12 Dec 2023 01:40PM - Gurvinder: Certainly, Sharon! The eligibility criteria for our scholarship program aim to ensure that students receive a quality education and a substantial scholarship. To be eligible:  Academic Requirements: Students need a minimum of 4 Grade 12 passes. These passes validate your completion of high school education and show a foundational academic proficiency.  Scholarship Test and Interview: Clearing our in-house scholarship test and interview with an overall aggregate of 80% and above is necessary. This helps us assess your academic readiness and commitment to excel in higher education.  Additionally, if a student has a grade equal to or higher than 6 (Grade Description: Satisfactory), we also consider special recommendations from School Heads. These recommendations take into account exceptional achievements in extracurricular activities or sports. This provides an opportunity for students who excel in areas beyond academics to be considered for the scholarship. 64 - 12 Dec 2023 03:42PM - Gurvinder: *Bachelor of Arts in Geography* is 3- year an undergraduate course divided into 6 semesters. It involves the study of the earth and its lands, features, inhabitants, and phenomena.  The course curriculum explores not only the geographical features of the earth but also its features and population. It is one of the specializations of Bachelor of Arts (BA) that deals in various areas such as the study of the features of soil, climate, and plantations are covered in the course besides the geography of the world as a whole.
65 - 12 Dec 2023 03:42PM - Gurvinder: Students enrolled to the course are taken to annual field trips to observe and analyse field data for stimulating awareness of the environment. They are also trained on cartography and report writing through presentations on thematic atlases and field reports. Upon successful completion of the course, graduates are lucratively hired both in private and public sectors, in colleges, universities, NGOs, among others.
66 - 12 Dec 2023 03:42PM - Gurvinder: *What is it About?*  BA in Geography is a 3- year course, minimum eligibility for which is an intermediate qualification in any discipline. Geography is the study of the earth, including aspects such as land, topography, attributes, people and phenomena. Subjects covered in the discipline are Environment and Ecology, Fundamentals of Remote Sensing and GIS, Statistical Techniques, Spatial Analysis, Advanced Physical Geography, Contemporary Human Geography, Computer Aided Mapping, Thematic Atlas, Spatial Economic Systems, Natural Resource Management, Political Geography, Agricultural Geography, Social Geography of India, Urban Settlement System, Regional Development, Cultural Geography, Hydrology and Water Resource Management, Environmental Impact Assessment, Geography of Landscape, Demography and Population Policy, Health, Environment and Society, among others.
66 - 12 Dec 2023 03:42PM - Gurvinder: *What is it About?*  BA in Geography is a 3- year course, minimum eligibility for which is an intermediate qualification in any discipline. 67 - 12 Dec 2023 03:42PM - Gurvinder: *Who Should Opt?*  Students with the capability of and interest in analysis, problem-solving, decision-making, critically interpreting data and text, developing reasoned arguments, numerical skills, team-work, planning skills, presenting oral and written arguments and information, communication and technology, are best suited for the course.
68 - 12 Dec 2023 03:43PM - Gurvinder: *Career Prospects*  Successful graduates of the course are professionally recruited as Urban and Regional Planners, Remote Sensing Specialists, Researchers etc.  They are also hired in research agencies meant for environmental issues, population studies and rural development, in the teaching profession at universities, colleges, schools and coaching institutes. The curriculum dives into essential subjects like mathematics, statistics, finance, and even explores elements of risk management and insurance – all pivotal components within the realm of Actuarial Science. If a person suddenly encounters any terrible danger, the change of nature one undergoes is equally great. Sometimes fear numbs our senses. Like animals, one stands still, powerless to move a step in fright or to lift a hand in defense of our lives, and sometimes one is seized with panic, and again, act more like the inferior animals than rational beings. On the other hand, frequently in cases of sudden extreme peril, which cannot be escaped by flight, and must be instantly faced, even the most timid men at once as if by miracle, become possessed of the necessary courage, sharp quick apprehension and swift decision. This is a miracle very common in nature. Man and the inferior animals alike, when confronted with almost certain death ‘ gather resolution from despair’ but there can really be no trace of so debilitating a feeling in the person fighting, or prepare d to fight for dear life. At such times the mind is clearer than it has ever been; the nerves are steel, there is nothing felt but a wonderful strength and daring. Looking back at certain perilous moments in my own life, I remember them with a kind of joy, not that there was any joyful excitement then, but because they broadened my horizon, lifted me for a time above myself.  1. The title that best suits the passage would be: a) The Change of Nature b) The Will to Fight c) Courage and Panic d) The Miracle of Confronting Danger  2.A man may react to sudden danger in three different ways . What are they? a) He may be paralyzed with fear, run away or fight. b) He may flee in panic, or fight back or stand still. c) He may be paralyzed with fear, or seized with panic, or as if by miracle, become possessed of the necessary courage, and face the danger. d) He may be paralyzed with fear, seized with panic or act like an inferior animal.  3.What is the meaning of the word debilitating ? a) enfeeble b) thriving c) strengthen d) debase  4. Explain the phrase ‘gather resolution from danger’. a) Find peace in times of difficulty. b) To remain calm and not to lose hope. c) A state of utter hopelessness makes one determined to face the difficulty. d) To be enthusiastic and brave the odds.  5. The author feels happy in the recollection of dangers faced and overcome because a) He felt elated as he was alive. b) They added a new perspective and lifted him above himself for a time. c) They brought him a new experience. d) These experiences boosted his confidence. The resulting increase in Greek yogurt production has forced those involved in the business to address the detrimental effects that the yogurt-making process may be having on the environment. Fortunately, farmers and others in the Greek yogurt business have found many methods of controlling and eliminating most environmental threats. 75 - 12 Dec 2023 12:06PM - Harmehak: Bachelor's degree in Commerce can provide a strong foundation for a career in Actuarial Sciences. Actuarial Sciences is the study of mathematical and statistical methods for assessing risk in the insurance and financial industries. Here are the steps that one can follow to work in Actuarial Sciences after pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Commerce:  Obtain actuarial certification: Actuaries are required to obtain professional certification from actuarial organizations, such as the Society of Actuaries (SOA) or the Casualty Actuarial Society (CAS). To obtain certification, actuaries must pass a series of exams that cover mathematical, statistical, and actuarial concepts.  Gain relevant experience: Actuaries are expected to have a strong understanding of the insurance and financial industries, as well as a deep knowledge of mathematics and statistics. To gain relevant experience, one can start working as a trainee in an insurance or financial services company and gain hands-on experience in actuarial work.  Network with other actuaries: Actuaries work in a close-knit community, and networking with other actuaries can help to expand one's knowledge and opportunities for growth. Actuaries can attend professional development events, join professional organizations, and participate in online forums to connect with other actuaries.  Continuously update knowledge: Actuarial Sciences is a rapidly evolving field, and it is important for actuaries to stay up-to-date with new developments and techniques. Actuaries can attend professional development events, participate in continuing education programs, and stay informed of industry news and trends.  In conclusion, a Bachelor's degree in Commerce provides a strong foundation for a career in Actuarial Sciences, but it takes dedication and hard work to succeed in this field. Actuaries are expected to have a deep understanding of mathematics, statistics, and the insurance and financial industries, and must continuously update their knowledge to stay relevant in the field.

81 - 12 Dec 2023 05:58PM - Harmehak: BSc Cardiovascular Technology is a 3-year degree program that deals with diagnosing and monitoring diseases related to the heart and the circulatory system.  In this program, students will get familiar with various complex procedures such as performing stent implants, setting up cardiac pacemakers and defibrillators in the treatment of heart diseases.  The BSc Cardiovascular Technology syllabus includes subjects such as Human Anatomy, Cardiovascular System, Physiology, Pathology, Electrocardiography and Echocardiography.  BSc Cardiovascular Technology degree holders will be able to find work in various sectors such as Hospitals, Universities, Health organizations etc.  They may also serve as Cardiovascular Technician, Cardiovascular Technologist, Medical Sonographer, etc. Graduates have the opportunity to work in India or Abroad to pursue graduate studies and to get involved in research activities.  After completing this course, students can pursue higher studies and advanced academic exploration along with research through MSc and Certificate Courses. Students can also pursue MBA, PGDM courses. These courses essentially provides a solid basis for further studies and related prospects.  *BSc Cardiovascular Technology: What is it about?* Read the points given below to know what BSc Cardiovascular Technology course is all about:  BSc in Cardiovascular Technology deals with various topics on the vascular or the circulatory system. Through this course, one gets to learn about the arteries, veins and the blood vessels that carry blood throughout the human body. These blood vessels are also instrumental in delivering oxygen and essential nutrients to the body tissues. With the help of this course one gets to learn about the various cardiovascular diseases that affect the human body. This course also helps a cardiovascular technologist or technician to learn about the various procedures and tests while assisting the physician in diagnosing and treating a patient ailing from heart disease. Some of the complex procedures that a student learns in this course are implanting of stents and setting up a pacemaker. They learn through this course, both invasive  as well as non-invasive procedures in the treatment of heart diseases.  *Why Should You Study a BSc Cardiovascular Technology course?*  BSc Cardiovascular Technology is a prestigious and popular stream of study in the field of allied health sciences. This field of study has a lot of importance and applications as it concerns directly with the treatment of heart diseases. Let us see here some of the reasons why one should study B.Sc Cardiovascular Technology.  With more and more people suffering from heart diseases because of many factors including lifestyle, genetics and environment, the importance of this field of study is ever increasing. Cardiologists and other heart surgeons greatly depend upon the services and support of cardiovascular technologists and technicians for carrying out various complex procedures on patients suffering from heart ailments. With congenital heart diseases too on the rise, that is those that are prevalent in patients from birth itself, there is an increased awareness among different walks of people about the risks associated with such heart diseases. This in turn, further brings the field in limelight, as people are more likely to avail the services of a cardiovascular technologist. The numerous advances in the medical field in this domain has been a boon for patients and the medical fraternity alike. With rapid advances in the field, the services are getting more and more affordable, with many availing such services.

55 - 12 Dec 2023 12:14PM - Harmehak: B.Sc. Biotechnology *BSc Biotechnology* is a 3-year undergraduate course that allows the candidates to learn how technology is utilized to create useful and necessary products from living organisms.  BSc Biotechnology Syllabus includes subjects such as Organic Mechanisms in Biology, Microbial Genetics, Molecular Genetics, DNA Typing, Proteomics & Beyond, etc.  After completing BSc Biotechnology, students can opt for MSc Biotechnology or other similar Biotechnology Courses available in India to grow their career in the field of Biotechnology.  *What is BSc Biotechnology?* Biotechnology is one of the most important fields in modern scientific research as the field deals with the application of biology and different techniques to modify products so that it can be used for human needs. The three year undergraduate course equips the aspirants with skills to alter the DNA of various living organisms.  *Why Study BSc Biotechnology?* BSc Biotechnology has lots of prospective career opportunities to offer to the students. Some of the benefits of pursuing the graduation in Biotechnology program are as follows:  >After completion of this course candidates will be equipped with the skills to excel in the Bioinformatics and Computer-Assisted Research and Analysis. >As this course covers a variety of practices and technical knowledge required in the medical field, it opens up a number of career prospects for the candidate. >Due to the constant innovation found in all industries nowadays, students can be assured of longevity in employment due to their knowledge in the field of Computer Science. This allows students to adapt their skills and knowledge to any changes in the industry. >Candidates who keep their knowledge updated according to the current trends and data will also have the option to diversify into the field of education. This is quite a popular career for graduates of BSc Biotechnology. >Another unique feature of this course is the inclusion of a Management & Entrepreneurship paper in the final semester. This equips graduates with the skills to perform well in positions of management and administration.  *Who Should Study BSc Biotechnology* >Candidates who have interest in genetics should pursue this subject as a career option. >Career as a biotechnologist requires continuous research in different fields. The candidates who are enthusiastic about research can opt for this course. >The biotechnologist works on altering the genetic material of plants and animals so that the production food and lifestocks increases . >Candidates who wish to work on food security can find interest in this course. >Students who are enthusiastic to develop drugs and vaccines can pursue this course.  *BSc Biotechnology Curriculum* The BSc Biotechnology Curriculum is generally divided into 6 semesters. The average length of each semester is 6 months. Candidates mainly learn about the core subjects in their second and third year. The candidates are sometimes required to go for a training in the final year of the course.  *BSc Biotechnology Syllabus and Subjects* The BSc Biotechnology syllabus includes a comprehensive and integrative curriculum of both theoretical and practical study spread over the six semesters in three years. A semester-wise breakup of the general syllabus for BSc Biotechnology is given below in a tabulated form :  *Semester 1* Macromolecular Structure and Analysis Biophysics & Instrumentation Cell Structure & Dynamics Biomathematics – I Chemistry  *Semester 2* Organic Mechanisms in Biology Principles of Transmission Genetics Principles of Microbiology Biomathematics – II Introduction to C-Programming & Digital Logic  *Semester 3* Microbial Genetics Principles of Immunology Plant and Animal Tissue Culture Techniques and applications Plant Biotechnology Introduction to Data Structure & Computer Organization  *Semester 4* Molecular Genetics Computational Biology & Bioinformatics Biodiversity & Taxonomy Animal Biotechnology Introduction to DBMS, Computer Network & Numerical Analysis  *Semester 5* DNA Typing, Proteomics & Beyond Recombinant DNA Technology Environmental Biotechnology Industrial Biotechnology  *Semester 6* Model Organisms in Human Genome Project Elements of Management Introduction and Entrepreneurship Medical Biotechnology Biotechnology- Social, Legal and Ethical issues

166 - 12 Dec 2023 06:22PM - +263 71 577 9523: Section 2 1:D 2:C 3:A 4:C 5:B  SECTION 3 6:C 7:A 8:C 9:B  SECTION 4 10:D 11:A 12:D 13:C 14:B 15: 16:B  SECTION 5  Many people believe that a poor diet is a result of inefficient farming methods in Africa.  However, this issue is far more complex and nuanced than it may seem.  First of all, there are many factors that contribute to food insecurity in Africa, including political instability, climate change, and lack of infrastructure.  These factors can make it difficult for farmers to produce enough food to meet the needs of the population.  Additionally, it's important to remember that Africa is a diverse continent with different climates, cultures, and economies.  Some regions of Africa have more fertile land and more efficient farming methods than others.  It's not fair to say that all Africans have poor diets because of inefficient farming methods.  In fact, many African farmers are using innovative techniques to improve their crop yields.  For example, some farmers are using hydroponics, a technique that allows them to grow crops without soil.  Others are using drip irrigation, a method that uses less water than traditional irrigation systems.  These techniques are making it possible for farmers to produce more food with the same amount of land.  In conclusion, it's not accurate to say that Africans have poor diets because their farms are stagnant and inefficient.  While it's true that some farmers in Africa face challenges, there are many people who are working hard to improve their farming methods and increase food production.  It's important to remember that Africa is a large and diverse continent, and there is no single solution that will solve all of the food security issues there.  However, with continued innovation and investment in agriculture, it's possible to make progress towards ensuring that all Africans have access to a healthy and nutritious diet.   SECTION 6  My life has been full of challenges, but I have always found a way to overcome them and move forward. The one thing that has always motivated me to keep going is my desire to make a difference in the world. This desire has led me to pursue an education.  When I was growing up, my family faced a lot of financial difficulties. My parents worked very hard to make ends meet, but there were times when we struggled to afford basic necessities like food and clothing. Despite these challenges, I never lost hope. I knew that I wanted to make a better life for myself and my family, and I was determined to succeed. I began to focus on my studies and set goals for myself. To help the students get a quality education and a scholarship, the Government has reconsidered the eligibility criteria and *as per the latest guidelines, the eligibility for the scholarship is a minimum of 2 Advanced Level passes.*    Even though the minimum requirement is two A-level passes, we always encourage students to aim for maximum points to increase their chances for a higher quantum of scholarship. 363 - 12 Dec 2023 01:27PM - Sahil Edoofa: Stacey's admission is for August 2025 Intake. Let me share with you for all the applicants who would be traveling to India for 2025 year's academic intake. Their application would utilize this time duration in the following ways  1. The student would be working on their Earn While You Learn Program:- Having a head start that too of more than 20 months helps a student have a better hold in their EWYL Journey. During these years, one thing which I have personally witnessed is that a student who have better understanding of their EWYL projects and the ones who earn higher amount of scholarship credits every month, are the ones who always had this headstart in their career.  Giving you an example, Persistance Muza the student who earned over $4000 worth or scholarship credits, became a part of the Edoofa Program for his August 2022 intake in August 2021. The student earned more than $1900 worth of scholarship credits before even coming to India and within just a couple of months after arriving he has now earned an additional $2100 worth of scholarship credits, which has ensured his parents that he can cater for his annual fee after the scholarship through his hard work in the Earn While You Learn Program itself.  This happened only because students like him had time to understand the projects and assignments while being in their home country.  2. Parents would be communicating with the Admission's Team:- Having ample amount of time in hand, not just benefits the student but actually helps the parent as well to plan better for their child's international education journey. Therefore to utilize this for your advantage, you would be interacting with the admissions team and start preparing for your child's international journey for 2025. This means that if you are supposed to start saving for your child's annual fee after scholarship, this becomes the right time since admission officers would brief you on a regular basis regarding how you should plan for the finances, if you face any challenges you could get the same addressed since you have time before your child finally travels.  3,  Having the benefit of the Community:- This part doesn't just benefits the student but actually benefits the entire family. The moment student becomes a part of the Edoofa Program he/she starts interacting with other students who are a part of the community, this helps the student to connect with toppers of their fields, students who have scored a perfect result in their A Level during their academic year, this way a student gets the access to get all his/her queries addressed in terms of academics for their current year of education from the topper students, thereby reducing the need of private tuitions for the same, for which the parents would have paid additional money over and above their school fee.

392 - 12 Dec 2023 02:33PM - Sahil Edoofa: Okay so basically you see in the first mode, the Direct Bank Transfer Mode, the transfer charges which are to be borne by the parents of the student ranges between $100 to $120 which become quite high for a lot of parents considering the economic situation in Zimbabwe itself. So as not every student is in a position to cater for an additional $100 to $120 just as transfer charge, the second mode was introduced, wherein, it is the Bank deposit in Mr. Charles's Account, in this the transfer charges get divided amongst 10 students resulting in an equivalent bearing of 12.5% at the end.  So as you can see in the letter that there is a Bank deposit in, Mr. Charles Jerera (Retired Education Officer)'s account as he is our Associated Partner there in Zimbabwe, Since 2020 there have been over 1400+ students who have been assisted by Mr Charles inorder to complete their enrollment formalities as well as university fee payments after arriving in India.
393 - 12 Dec 2023 02:33PM - Sahil Edoofa: Therefore the fee can also be paid through him. Since his account is a NOSTRO Account which only holds USD itself, therefore the necessary amount including the transfer charges in this mode itself would be $394 ($350 + $44 transfer charges), and the same details are as below:-  BANK NAME: FBC  SWIFT CODE: FBCPZWHA  ACC NAME: CHARLES JERERA  ACC NUMBER: 5333 0380 1404 8828  CONTACT NUMBER: +263 77 376 9854

We also have in group *Mr. Jyotishman, Head of Admissions at Edoofa* and *Mr. Sahil, Senior Career Counselor at Edoofa*  We have received the application of *Astra Totamirepi* for the Edoofa Scholarship program. Before we begin the counseling and evaluation session, I would like to share with you all more about the program so that we connect on time with utmost seriousness!
13 - 12 Dec 2023 03:55PM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: *Edoofa Scholarship Program* is a well-appreciated program in the SAARC nations and the African continent offering 50-100% scholarships on tuition fees. Over the past 6 years, we have worked with 250+ Universities in India and have a community of more than 4000 students from different African countries. We receive applications from South Africa, Zimbabwe, Ghana, Nigeria, Malawi, Uganda, Zambia, Liberia, Kenya, Rwanda, Cameroon, and many more countries. For more than 50,000 applications there are just 5000 scholarship seats which denote the intense competition and the strict eligibility process to find deserving students and *make education, not just affordable and accessible to them but also employability driven so that Edoofians become future leaders in their domains!*
14 - 12 Dec 2023 03:55PM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: Speaking specifically about Zimbabwe, we have more than 2000 students enrolled in the program. We are associated with more than 200 schools in Zimbabwe. Some of the most elite Schools in Zimbabawe example in Harare we are collaborated with St. Dominic’s Chishawasha, Dominican Convent, Christ Ministries and many others. In Manicaland we have a total of 18 Schools to name a few St. David’s Girls Bonda, Hartzell High, First Class, First Choice and so on.  Chipinge we have Chibuwe High School, you would be happy to know that the DEO’s of Mutare and Chipinge have their kids under the Edoofa Scholarship. Masvingo we have 24 Schools collaborated with over 300 students from some of the best schools example Pamushana, St. Antony’s, Reformed Church Gutu, Zaka High and many others. The program is also appreciated by the Education Inspector of Bikita Madam Makomeke.We have more than 500 students from Mashonaland (West, Central and East) Province, Midlands Province.  Last but not the Least we also have Schools from Bulawayo and Matebaland South associated with Edoofa. Our collaborations with the UCE College Bulawayo adds a feather to the Cap of trust that Edoofa has built in a span of 14 years.  The Schools, Institutions and Educationists who have made efforts to train the students for this prestigious Scholarship Program are also the Authorized Designatories of EDOOFA in Zimbabawe. We have Mr. Shorwi Kawadza (Retd. Headmaster Hartzell), Mr. Charles Jerera (Retd. Ministry of Education), Ms. Christina Rockson (Founder and Principal of Hilltop Christian College in SA) who have shown relentless efforts to guide students on the right path to success.EDOOFA boasts a proud students and parents community of more than 2000 from Zimbabwe who are happy with the quality of education and the employability outcomes.

Computer Science* Syllabus gives you a vast knowledge of calculus, algorithms, computer architecture, database learning etc. A person who has an interest in grasping computer technology from grass root to zenith can opt for this course.  Cloud Computing has become one of the most important topics of conversation among the IT community. Cloud computing is used by many businesses, whose employees and customers could access their data with a variety of Internet-connected devices. This way, these businesses don’t have to build and run their own data centers, which can be way more expensive. The Cloud Computing and Virtualization specialization prepares students to understand the emerging technologies of Cloud Computing and Virtualization, their principles, modeling, analysis, design, deployment, and industry-oriented applications. Major solution architectures and enabling technologies are covered.  The Cloud Computing Program prepares students to understand the  Emerging technologies of Cloud Computing and Virtualization Principles, modeling, analysis, design, deployment, and industry-oriented applications Major solution architectures and enabling technologies Developing of applications and services  Opportunities exist in the area of Design Engineering, Computing/IT Consulting and Solution Developers. Computer Engineer would have various job opportunities in various MNC’s . as Computer Engineer, Software developer, Software tester, Network administrator, Database administrator, Database designer, Database operator, Website designer, Website developer, Mobile application developer, Robotics expert, Software analyst. 68 - 12 Dec 2023 12:57PM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: B.Sc. Nutrition and Dietetics  *B.Sc. in Nutrition and Dietetics* is a 3- year long full- time undergraduate course divided over 6 semesters. It involves the study of food management, promotion of health through healthy food, and primarily focusses on the relationship between the body and food. B.Sc. in Nutrition and Dietetics essentially involves an advanced learning in ways to enhance the quality of life and overall well-being by promoting healthy diet behaviors and exploring healthier dietary modifications.  The program consists of a comprehensive curriculum that combines the science of nutrition with a broader view of wellness, community and environment, delving into reasons for unhealthy eating behaviors and ways to rectify and improve the same.  Students interested in learning about nutritional matters and food habits, and in training in health care units such as clinics, hospitals and community nutrition in close proximity of doctors, clinicians and dieticians, are best suited for a B.Sc. in Nutrition & Dietetics.  Ideal candidates would have relevant skills such as tact, team spirit and compassion, and an inherent instinct to counsel, guide, and treat patients suffering from diet- based health issues.  Nutrition and Dietetics is fast- growing both as an academic discipline and in practical application, both in India and abroad. Successful graduates of the course interested in further studies in the discipline may pursue M.Sc., M.Phil. and Ph. D in the same subject. Those interested in professionally working in the industry and find lucrative employment opportunities in private sector clinics and hospitals, or may get self-employed.  Other areas of employment include private sector organizations such as leisure cruise companies and private nursing homes. Such graduates may also choose to become psychiatric nursing as a profession where they work with patients suffering from emotional and psychological distress caused from unhealthy diet patterns.

301 - 12 Dec 2023 05:28PM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: I understand what you are sharing, basically, my motive behind asking such a question was the fact that, as a counsellor, I have helped tens of thousands of students in the last 5 and a half years in Zimbabwe, and I do understand that financial stability in an economy like Zimbabwe is quite difficult these days. This is why I want to ask you if your child manages to pass the eligibility check stage, then you would have to complete payment of $350 towards the enrollment fee.  I feel in Zimbabwe, economic hardship has become a daily reality for parents as the country struggles with a fragile economy and high unemployment rate. In the past decade, Zimbabwe has seen hyperinflation, a collapse of the currency, a high poverty rate, and a rising cost of living. This has caused financial instability for many Zimbabwean families and made it increasingly difficult for parents to provide for their children. Parents are often forced to take on multiple jobs to make ends meet and many have had to cut back on basic necessities such as food, clothing, and education. Many parents have had to leave their children in the care of relatives or send them to live with friends in order to provide for them. This has put an enormous strain on the family unit as well as on the children who are not receiving the parental care and attention they need.

94 - 12 Dec 2023 10:14AM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: BSc Cardiovascular Technology  *BSc Cardiovascular Technology* is a 3-year degree program that deals with diagnosing and monitoring diseases related to the heart and the circulatory system.  In this program, students will get familiar with various complex procedures such as performing stent implants, setting up cardiac pacemakers and defibrillators in the treatment of heart diseases.  The BSc Cardiovascular Technology syllabus includes subjects such as Human Anatomy, Cardiovascular System, Physiology, Pathology, Electrocardiography and Echocardiography.  BSc Cardiovascular Technology degree holders will be able to find work in various sectors such as Hospitals, Universities, Health organizations etc.  They may also serve as Cardiovascular Technician, Cardiovascular Technologist, Medical Sonographer, etc. Graduates have the opportunity to work in India or Abroad to pursue graduate studies and to get involved in research activities.  After completing this course, students can pursue higher studies and advanced academic exploration along with research through MSc and Certificate Courses. Students can also pursue MBA, PGDM courses. These courses essentially provides a solid basis for further studies and related prospects.  *BSc Cardiovascular Technology: What is it about?* Read the points given below to know what BSc Cardiovascular Technology course is all about:  BSc in Cardiovascular Technology deals with various topics on the vascular or the circulatory system. Through this course, one gets to learn about the arteries, veins and the blood vessels that carry blood throughout the human body. These blood vessels are also instrumental in delivering oxygen and essential nutrients to the body tissues.  With the help of this course one gets to learn about the various cardiovascular diseases that affect the human body.   This course also helps a cardiovascular technologist or technician to learn about the various procedures and tests while assisting the physician in diagnosing and treating a patient ailing from heart disease. Some of the complex procedures that a student learns in this course are implanting of stents and setting up a pacemaker. They learn through this course, both invasive  as well as non-invasive procedures in the treatment of heart diseases.  *Why Should You Study a BSc Cardiovascular Technology course?*  BSc Cardiovascular Technology is a prestigious and popular stream of study in the field of allied health sciences. This field of study has a lot of importance and applications as it concerns directly with the treatment of heart diseases. Let us see here some of the reasons why one should study B.Sc Cardiovascular Technology.  With more and more people suffering from heart diseases because of many factors including lifestyle, genetics and environment, the importance of this field of study is ever increasing. Cardiologists and other heart surgeons greatly depend upon the services and support of cardiovascular technologists and technicians for carrying out various complex procedures on patients suffering from heart ailments.   With congenital heart diseases too on the rise, that is those that are prevalent in patients from birth itself, there is an increased awareness among different walks of people about the risks associated with such heart diseases. This in turn, further brings the field in limelight, as people are more likely to avail the services of a cardiovascular technologist. The numerous advances in the medical field in this domain has been a boon for patients and the medical fraternity alike. With rapid advances in the field, the services are getting more and more affordable, with many availing such services.

259 - 12 Dec 2023 02:03PM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: Basically there are 3 phases of the enrollment process.  *Phase 1:* Counseling session with the Students/Parents and Seat Reservation If the student is found competent for the program and receives their Reservation Letter, you will have to pay only a part of the Program Fee which is $350 within 7 days from the receipt of your Edoofa Reservation Letter which basically is for the seat reservation and the Earn While You Learn Program. *Phase 2:* Once the students complete their Phase 1 they will be starting their Earn While you Learn program classes (Each student will have an opportunity to earn credits that can be used to reduce the fee before their A-Level result is out). *Phase 3:* Once the final A results are out if the student would have passed the necessary requirement as per Edoofa then their final University evaluation and Admission would be continued. However if the student wouldn't have met the necessary requirements as per the University and Edoofa, then the paid $350 would be refunded to the parents. *The amount of credit earned by the students during Phase 2 can be used for the student's first year's annual fee as well so that parents do not end up being burdened at the last moment.*
260 - 12 Dec 2023 02:04PM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: However, we do know that in most African Nations, economic instability is a major challenge because of which a student might face a challenge in completing their entire fee in a short time span of 7 days, therefore for such instances, parents are provided with flexible fee payment option as well, wherein if the student is found eligible then instead of paying the entire fee in 7 days, parents can complete a part fee of $200 in 7 days and the remaining $150 within next 30 days.
